lexUnit.name: file.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to move oneself in a line with others

sentence.text: THE colours were bright as the mourners filed into the church yesterday to celebrate the life of the murdered art student Paul Sheldon .
As she filed into the bus with the girls and boys , Sara almost felt back at school again herself .
The police filed into the office .
Four thousand Schoolchildren from all over Oxfordshire will be filing into the Old Fire Station over the next few days to enjoy the drama , and displays .
They file into the office and sit round the long oak table , slightly in awe of Vic , serious men in chain-store suits , with pens and pencils sticking out of their breast pockets .
They filed into the temple , a stream of garish colour and silly hats and bare white flesh .
The five of them filed into a cab and were decanted outside the Hospitality Inn .
The door closed , then Black turned to watch Miranda 's face as the five men filed into the adjoining room .

The physicists who had presented papers at the Tricentennial filed into the lecture hall , where their fellow delegates and the faculty of the University of Angleby were gathered with the Vice-Chancellor , awaiting them .
The buses were parked and the children filed through the gate which led to their own fenced-off domain .
Only the day before , those noble , horned beasts had been filing unsuspectingly through the long grass of the plain , intending to wallow harmlessly in some cool place through the heat of the day .
As the party filed through the front door , the girl called out , ` Cheerio , Beth .
In a silence vibrating with silent accusation the three of them filed through the gap in the croton hedge .
` I need to talk to you , " said Robert to Maisie , as the school filed out towards the Village .
He still drew from life , of men and women filing towards the mine shaft through the snow and of miners holding lamps , bent double under loaded sacks .
The servants filed silently from the room until only the housekeeper remained .
` Before dawn we filed slowly forward , many stops , to the assault positions .
The constable stood to one side to allow the detectives to file past him , Norman Pinder slouching between them .
As they filed out of the building onto the sidewalk , Grant eyed the sheriff 's broad back and wondered what Springfield was holding back .
Vic dismisses the meeting and , as the men file out , stands up and stretches .
